turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Colorado Midland Railway.
turn.1: What was the difference between the divided and non-divided railway?
turn.2: The ascent from Colorado Springs to Divide was also severe, with several stretches of 4% grade and significant curvature.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The portion of the line from Leadville to Hagerman Pass provided the setting for some of the finest railroad imagery ever taken.
turn.6: Especially noteworthy was the work of W. H. Jackson, particularly the photos circa 1890 showing the rise over five levels and the massive wood trestle leading to the final tier.
turn.7: What was the most scenic route?
turn.8: Even after the boring of the Busk-Ivanhoe Tunnel, much of this trackage was above nine thousand feet, in a district of Colorado where the snow often does not melt entirely until June.
turn.10: The railroad was difficult to operate at the best of times, and in winter it was often nearly impossible: the 1899 blizzard closed the line over Hagerman Pass for 77 days and cost the company more than $73,000 (approx $2 million in 2013).
turn.12: As great a problem as topography was, the route and terminals posed a still greater one.
